text:
e="preserve">Jack Kehoe (November 21, 1934 – January 14, 2020) was an American actor. He was born in California. His best known roles were in "Serpico" (1973), "The Pope of Greenwich Village" (1984) and Brian De Palma's "The Untouchables" (1987), as well as the cult favorites "Car Wash" (1976) and "Midnight Run" (1988), the popular western "Young Guns II" (1990), and "On the Nickel" (1980).
Kehoe died on January 14, 2020 from stroke-related problems in Los Angeles at the age of 85.
